title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 ยง 331.2 - Report of attending psychologist
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 ยง 331.2 - Report of attending psychologist

State Regulations

The attending psychologist shall obtain from the claimant a
complete history of the claimant's injury or condition and shall report this to
the chair, together with a full report of the known injury or condition as
determined by his or her examination and diagnosis, as well as of any other
injury or condition. Known injury or condition includes any condition the
existence of which is ascertainable through psychological diagnosis and
evaluation. Reported injury or condition includes any condition the existence
of which is ascertainable either visually or from an authoritative source, such
as the claimant, employer, a physician, etc. The report of injury or condition
so ascertained shall not be deemed to constitute a professional diagnosis or
opinion. Notes

331.2

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
